head.title: Man Sought in Shooting Shoots Self, Police Say

hedline.hl1: Man Sought in Shooting Shoots Self, Police Say

block.p: A Sussex County man who shot his ex-wife yesterday morning turned a gun on himself outside a mall in Mount Olive Township last night, the police said.

The man, William Gallagher, 47, of Byram Township, shot himself as the police approached him outside the Wayne Town Center Mall at 6:20 P.M., said Police Chief Charles Brown of Mount Olive, in Morris County, about 40 miles west of New York City.
A Sussex County man who shot his ex-wife yesterday morning turned a gun on himself outside a mall in Mount Olive Township last night, the police said.

The man, William Gallagher, 47, of Byram Township, shot himself as the police approached him outside the Wayne Town Center Mall at 6:20 P.M., said Police Chief Charles Brown of Mount Olive, in Morris County, about 40 miles west of New York City.

The police said Mr. Gallagher shot his ex-wife, Margaret Sepe, 42, of Byram Township, about 9 A.M. as she was on her way to work in Mount Olive Township. Ms. Sepe was flown to Morristown Memorial Hospital with gunshot wounds to her arm and leg. She identified the gunman as her ex-husband, the police said.
Mr. Gallagher was taken to St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center in Paterson, where he was in critical condition.
